title: What about a KB article elimination process before you can make a Help and Support Discussion
body:
I think this would eliminate a lot of information being repeated on the boards, explaining things to people who think their problem is unique. For example:

You click on "Create A Discussion"

The page provides a list of the nature of the problem:

- Client
- Game
- Bans
- Report a hacker

Then it gets more granular. Say you then click on Client, the next list shows things like:

- Shop
- Chat
- Loot
- Champion selection

And depending on the sub tree selection you've made, a suggestion for relevant KB articles and FAQs are provided.

I think this would give the documentation written for users a lot more publicity and clear the boards up if it was an enforced process prior to creating a discussion in Help and Support.

What do you think Rito, would it save you guys a lot of hassle in this area?

replies.body: Well ideally that's what the pinned thread in H and S is for https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/LbPY3Rpr-experiencing-a-tech-problem-find-the-common-fixes-here . As to what you are suggesting, boards just isn't capable of it at the moment and there are no resources available for boards dev atm.

Hi Seras,

That URL returns a 404 for me but I found the page you mean. This is a good spot for that information. 

As for the resources, I see Riot are looking for a web dev in Taiwan, and one of the job roles is:

"Tap the pulse of the Taiwan/Hong Kong/Macau League communities to better identify and produce the features and systems that leagueoflegends.com needs to deliver a first-rate player experience"

Is that PR speak for monitoring the boards?

We're nearly into the new financial year so maybe there will be more resources coming up. 

Just a suggestion anyway.

Cheers
